title: Ticket #112: In OSG ProcD, procd_ctl LIST broken for subfamilies
description: The OSG ProcD allows a list of processes it is tracking to be displayed along with some resource usage information via the procd_ctl LIST command. This command's syntax also allows a PID to be given in order to restrict the listing to a sub-family. This feature is broken, however; the listing will always include all processes being tracked by the ProcD.
remarks:
2009-Feb-24 13:46:45 by gquinn:
This is now fixed.
creator: gquinn
